title: Found out the hardway how Yi's ult actually works.
body:
I've been playing this game for fucking years my dudes. Years. And I had 0 idea this entire time that {{item:3075}} {{item:3143}} and {{item:3110}} 's passives have no effect on him while he is ulted. I just found this out last game when a teammate pointed it out to me while Yi ran through my 5k hp cho with {{item:3075}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3110}}  and was completely unfazed in terms of attack speed. The only thing I could do was sell my frozen heart, pick up a rabbadons and hope that I could kill him before he killed me. 

So I guess there literally is no way to stop Yi after he's ulted except to kill him before he wipes you out.

> [{quoted}](name=Ludicol0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIjEuE7k,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-04-23T11:16:11.511+0000)
>
> yi is too braindead he needs a rework

Yi actually takes more thinking to play than riven and i know i sound fucking xrazy but you have to time your shit properly when you play yi, i dont even play that guy.

This however, stops applying when he is very ahead so i see where ypu come from

There's a difference between thinking and complex combos and thinking and timing though. Yi isn't exactly hard. Once you learn to stand back and not be the initiator, but the finisher, games become immensely easier. Games where Yi loses, he generally thinks he's a tank and yolo's in.

As a finisher he's unstoppable, because every kill gives 7 seconds more to his ult. You may be competent enough to beat Yi, but your team usually isn't, which ends up leading to YOUR death, because you outplaying Yi for 7 Seconds made you vulnerable to his NEXT 7 seconds.
Yes, you are crazy for  comparing the least requiring skill champion with one of the most skill requiring champs
She isn't the most skill requiring but definitely on the top, it's known among all players that have a brain to understand that. Riven is just broken now and that's why so many players abuse her

I rly want to offend you somehow but i am still stuck up on this brain thingie, why is everyone trying to point it out that he is being smart for having one of those?


Okay  i have made up my mind here is my counter cuz surely it's known among all palyers that have brain to  understand that riven is by far nowhere even near requiring skill as  much as ppl claim since she has nothing  to go skillwise otherthan animation canceling provided you will   not get an epilepsic stroke spaming her low cd skill overloaded whit moblity.

This is what Spear of shojin does to her, every high elo player knows that riven requires A LOT of skill to learn and master

And if you're so sure that Riven doesn't require skill you can just play her and prove it yourself :)

This is so true. Yi is actually a lot more difficult to make work than nearly everyone realizes. Yi is exceptionally good pre-30 and from Iron 4 to Silver 4. But from Silver 4 and upwards, he becomes quite difficult to use. He is still a monster but you can no longer just R and get multi-kills mindlessly like you could do pre-30 or low Bronze players. You actually have to think about what you're doing, same as if you were playing Riven or Fiora. You try that mindless right click shit in Silver and you'd just feed your ass off. It's not that Silver players are gods or anything, far from it. It's just that Yi has very easily exploitable weaknesses that even average players with moderate experience can use to their advantage consistently vs Yi. You still get games where you can R and mindlessly right click your way to victory in Silver and up but not consistently enough where you could just breeze your way through those elos. You will feed in a lot of those games if you don't think about what you're doing.

Don't need to think shit. Thinking is for those who don't build {{item:3231}} to get out of that Lux's Q.

Don't worry, she'll be respawning while your cooldown refreshes.

> [{quoted}](name=Haze97,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIjEuE7k,comment-id=000000010004,timestamp=2019-04-24T22:58:49.152+0000)
>
> Don't need to think shit. Thinking is for those who don't build {{item:3231}} to get out of that Lux's Q.
> 
> Don't worry, she'll be respawning while your cooldown refreshes.

thats kind of dumb considering the fact only bad yi's build that item if they dont know how to properly use yi's kit to function in teamfights. U have a QSS on ur Q, essentially, and when you dont use the Q properly or too early, there isnt a point and you die. A lot of yi players engage ganks with Q and either end up taking turret dmg, or die without any successful gank unless the person is below 25% hp. The propper way to gank with Yi or any big gap closer champion is to first walk up, without using your mobility, wait for them to flash, or get away, then use your mobility. You can use Yi's Q to dodge so much and outplay so well its unbelievable the amount of mechanics a right click champ has. I once outplayed an adc who was autoing me in my W when my Q had a 5 second cooldown. I waiting for my W to stack my passive, and waiting for my Q to go to 2 second cd (i was at 15% hp mind you) I then flash up to her, get my passive auto off, Q, then auto attack with E enabled. I dont know how much of this you understand but i hope you do.

You can't deal with his true damage but you can deal with his physical damage
thats why the counter to vayne is armor instead of health
you are going to resist more damage from vayne with high armor values than high health values
ofcourse you need a middle ground so other champions don't melt you instead

and yes highlander immunes all kind of slows including Fear Charm and Poly
this includes atk speed slows 

CC is the best counter to YI and as cowsep throws fits every game Zhonya
any way to make him stop playing or extend your life counters yi

Alistar alone can shut down an Yi completely
A fiddle fear alone denies Yis full highlander

a long time ago i had an Yi OTP repeatedly against me like 3-4 games straight
he smashed the first 2 games without an effort
the next games i kept picking fiddle into him and saving my fear for him alone
and he was completely useless

getting stunned as mundo for 2 secs isn't as disastrous as getting stunned as yi for 2 secs. 

As for your statement that he is alpha striking to dodge your cc and damage, I'll give you this question.

Why aren't you just timing your cc to hit him right out of alpha? You know how long it takes, and you basically always know where he's gonna show up. Literally just count 1 sec in your head then throw cc at the first target of alpha.

Not only that, but you strawmanned my argument. I didn't say CC counters every champ (though, obviously, it does to an extent) I said it isn't groundbreaking that CC works, considering it is an effective way to make someone *not be able to do what they want to do*. If the only way to beat someone is to essentially make them go afk, then there's an issue.

When i pick malphite against vayne i go AP actually and just solo kill her every time
if she flashes the R i just die but she can do that only once per 4 deaths so it's worth as long as it's not the game deciding fight

Play something like {{champion:58}} and get fed. whenever he shows up stunlock him with w. The ignorance is strong with you downvote bots. Anyways i will keep on killing yis with olaf, jax, kled and renekton i know what i am talking about.
Until you pass the 25 min mark and renek becomes useless and yi 1 shot him xd

They should really change this. AS slow items are literally the only possible defense you could build against Yi's mixed + true damage and yet even those items are negated.

There is quite literally no way at all to counter-build Yi right now.

> [{quoted}](name=Z3Sleeper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIjEuE7k,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-04-23T11:58:57.181+0000)
>
> They should really change this. AS slow items are literally the only possible defense you could build against Yi's mixed + true damage and yet even those items are negated.
> 
> There is quite literally no way at all to counter-build Yi right now.

I've always felt this applies more to Vayne. Yes, Yi gets true damage, and you can't reduce his attack speed, but it's a static amount of true damage, and he still deals lots of physical. Therefore building HP+armor *does* extend your life duration against him...he just does a lot of damage, so it may not feel like it.

Vayne on the other hand deals  % of your total HP in true damage. THAT is a case of literally no way to counter build, other than attack speed reduction of which there is a limited amount.

It's all fine and dandy til he's dealing 24% current health physical damage, 12% max health magic damage and 150 (+ 105% bonus AD) true damage every 2 autos (not even including his passive which makes all those numbers even bigger). Also that 10% of all those % health on-hits are being converted to true damage.

So, Im a little confused with your numbers. 

Im assuming the 24% current health is from bork? It's 8% so with phantom hit it would be 16% and Yi has no max health damage in his kit and no item grants that. Wuju style deals 50 bonus damage plus 35% bonus ad in true damage, Im not gonna do the math on that but where is the 105% bonus ad thing coming from?

Im not arguing anything but I dont see where the numbers are coming from. Also, bork is a pretty rare buy, it would make more sense to factor in Wit's End damage instead, since it's so strong on him now. 

Your numbers are also assuming he has conq and guinsoo's stacked at the start of the fight, and turns on Wuju Style right as conq procs and guinsoo's becomes stacked, which is half the battle as Yi. If you arent fully stacked your damage is literally cut in half, that's a huge window of vulnerability.

It lasts for 7 seconds. If everyone on your team can stay alive against him for that long, then it's gone. If someone dies, it continues for another 7 seconds and that can repeat until it finally times out or everyone on your team is dead. So actually, armor can help against him considering that. But yeah, crowd control would be more useful.
Have you ever been in a teamfight this season that lasted 7 seconds without anyone dying?

For so many people crying Yi is a braindead champ with no skill, I find it hillarious no one can think two steps forward into beating him. Lmao, pick and play your Talon, Kayn, Yasuo, Riven, Camilles. Pick your over loaded champs with over loaded kits. And get rekt by a "brain dead champ" and realize all your try harding is useless without any actual skill or understanding of the game.

Did you know I walked away from a Yi once? It was insane. He only hit me twice. Nerf walk speed Riot pls.

the biggest issue with yi is that he thrives in solo Q. i dont feed yi, but my team will feed him and i cant do anything because they will be tilted and not know to cc him and cc hi mafter he QSS. and the games over

lck people dont feed the enemy jungler. its 2-2 like 22 minutes in. solo q its 14 mins in 22-22 aka he thrives.

Perhaps the main reason I can't fully enjoy this game: My success is directly tied to the performance of four other strangers. And because of Riot's rules, I can't "encourage" my team mates to do better, because simply asking our lvl3 Eve to stop trying to invade Kha Zix will result in Eve feeling that she's been attacked and reporting us for harass.

Every game is nothing but Riot's algorythym struggling to keep you in a 50/50 win/lose ratio. Is it "time" for you to win? Riot gives you competant players and gives the enemy team 1 afk and 1 tilter. And almost always 1 person that while they try, they are just bad.

Is it "time" for  you to lose? Riot will give you an afk and a Leona/Lux duo bot lane and pit you up against a player enemy team 3 whole tiers above you. I have very little control over any game's outcome, barely any control over my own performance. And video games are supposed to be fun. They're supposed to reward a player's skill expression. This game does not.

Please lemme join i have tales too:
-like the time i flashed away from him AFTER HE  LANDED HIS Q and he could not follow me anymore what a brilliant idea
-or the time i was using zony he q's on me and pops out like a total  stoog getting killed by my ignite
-OR the time i was landing my CC skillshot E whit velkoz under myself  cuz as a yi main i know  where he will pop out  from the q and just straight  wqr ed him right after as he  sloged to the conclusion hes DED
-or the time when  i literaly landed any kind of skill on him 
-or the time  when anyone in my team had any idea how to play the game  and not lose literally to any champ 

Oh  gosh the tales for the campfire are the besties indeed.
*Listens to the good hearty campfire tales of the rift and nods with a chug of his ale*

thornmail is also a joke of an item. You'd gain more from just buying few potions and drink 'em as they attack you.

All that hate huh
